abstract: Supreme Court issues order suggesting effort to avoid 4-to-4 deadlock in case brought by religious groups objecting to Affordable Care Act mandate that they provide female employees with insurance coverage for birth control; order tells parties to file supplemental briefs.
lead_paragraph: Less than a week after oral arguments, the court called for supplemental briefs in an unusually elaborate order that seemed to envision new federal regulations.

headline.main: Supreme Court Hints at Way to Avert Tie on Birth Control Mandate
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Order Hints at Way to Avert Deadlock on Birth Control Mandate

snippet: Less than a week after oral arguments, the court called for supplemental briefs in an unusually elaborate order that seemed to envision new federal regulations.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
